page.title: 16Ipplepen flower show.
page.content: { Ipplepen Cottage Garden Society}was {established}in{1890.}It now runs an annual flower show which is held on the third Saturday in July at the playing field. A large marquee is erected on Friday afternoon. { On the morning of the show}entries are taken to the tent between 8 and 10 a.m. There are{classes for vegetables, fruit, wines, domestic, floral arts, flowers, needlework and handicrafts.The children have separate classes. Each entry costs 3p. { This year the weather has been poor, but the tent was filled with displays of roses, sweet peas, dahlias, hanging baskets, house plants, flans, sponges, red and white wines, onions, potatoes, carrots, runner beans, peas, jams, pictures and photographs.{Local groups have sideshows to boost society funds The show is a popular parish event.
